articles.headline: Crypto miners are killing free CI
content: CI providers like LayerCI, GitLab, TravisCI, and Shippable are all worsening or shutting down their free tiers due to cryptocurrency mining attacks.

On September 1st, 2020, GitLab announced that their free CI offering was being restricted in response to "usage." Two months later, TravisCI announced that a similar restriction in response to "significant abuse."

articles.headline: Why some developers are avoiding app store headaches by going web-only
content: Earlier this month, the indie developers Feross Aboukhadijeh and John Hiesey launched a new app called Wormhole, which lets users quickly share large, encrypted files with just a "link". But unlike most new mobile apps, Wormhole doesn‚Äôt show up in Apple‚Äôs App Store or the Google Play Store.

articles.headline: This programmer reverse engineered the Pfizer mRNA vaccine source code
content: Reverse Engineering the source code of the BioNTech/Pfizer SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine
Sadly, You Can't Print Your Own (safe) mRNA Vaccine [article]

articles.headline: Blockchain, the amazing solution for almost nothing
content: Blockchain technology is going to change everything: the shipping industry, the financial system, government ‚Ä¶ in fact, what won‚Äôt it change? But enthusiasm for it mainly stems from a lack of knowledge and understanding. The blockchain is a solution in search of a problem.

articles.headline: This is The Entire Computer Science Curriculum in 1000 YouTube Videos
content: In this article, we are going to create an entire Computer Science curriculum using only YouTube videos. The Computer Science curriculum is going to cover every skill essential for a Computer Science Engineer that has expertise in Artificial Intelligence and its subfields, like: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, NLP, etc.

articles.headline: Linus Torvalds rails against 80-character lines as a de facto programming standard
content: Linux kernel overlord Linus Torvalds has railed against 80-character-lines as a de facto programming standard ‚Äì and has moved to make reminders to keep things short a thing of the past.

articles.headline: Kids find a security flaw in Linux Mint by mashing keys
content: A few weeks ago, my kids wanted to hack my linux desktop, so they typed and clicked everywhere, while I was standing behind them looking at them play... when the screensaver core dumped and they actually hacked their way in! wow, those little hackers... üêà

articles.headline: Rockstar thanks GTA Online player who fixed poor load times, official update coming
content: A player recently claimed to have improved GTA Online‚Äôs loading times by up to 70 percent. Turns out, they were right.
Rockstar Games has confirmed to PC Gamer that a fan-made solution to GTA Online's abysmal loading times will become official in a forthcoming update.

articles.headline: To the brain, reading computer code is not the same as reading language
content: Neuroscientists find that interpreting code activates a general-purpose brain network, but not language-processing centers.

‚ÄúUnderstanding computer code seems to be its own thing. It‚Äôs not the same as language, and it‚Äôs not the same as math and logic,‚Äù says Anna Ivanova, an MIT graduate student and the lead author of the study.
